title: Garden Party
description: Andy claims to be throwing a garden party at Dwight's farm to impress Robert California, but he's really doing it to win the approval of his parents, who appear to favor his younger brother.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [entering office] Hey. So, we saw a new billboard.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah? Pretty cool, huh?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What better way to announce our new slightly lower prices than with an ad campaign? And what better face for an ad campaign than our new regional manager?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: How'd it look?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You've seen it, right?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Andy, somebody defaced it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What? [Stanley enters office laughing] Morning, Stanley.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: There's this thing that people tend to do with billboards. How do I put this? If there's an opportunity for a graffiti artist to work in a... phallic shape, interacting with the artwork, it'll happen, and Andy gave them that opportunity.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Erin, how long did we order those billboards for?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Six months.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, god. I need you to call the billboard company.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [entering office] Great billboard! Funny, edgy, right up to the line without crossing it, loved it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Which one did you see?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Washington Street, the one with, like, twenty dongs on it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, don't be gross.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [entering office] What's going on?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Somebody defaced the billboards we just put out in an inappropriate way.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, that's funny. Wait, from the photo shoot with you and me?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No. No. No! NO! NO! NO! NO! NO! [running from building] No, no, no, no, no, no, No, No, No, NO, NO! NO! NO! NO! [stopping in front of defaced billboard] NOOOOOOOOO!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Schrute Farms is very easy to find, it's right in the middle of the root vegetable district. If the soil starts to get acidic, you've probably gone too far.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Just give us the address. We'll look it up online.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's simpler this way.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It's really not.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Now, stated arrival time is 3 p.m.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I don't get the reason for this party.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah, what's the reason?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: What's the reason, Andy? What's the reason?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's just a garden party. Sheesh.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You don't need a reason to throw a garden party anymore than you need a reason to throw a birthday party. It's a garden party. You don't need a reason.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Few other super simple reminders - no burping, no slurping, when eating take small bites and chew thoroughly with your mouth closed. Yes, Darryl?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What happens when we're done chewing? Do we spit it out on the floor, or keep it in our mouths the rest of the time?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I get it, I'm being a little overbearing. But I promise to be underbearing for a week if you guys just all... step it up.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Andy, we understand basic table manners, we're not children.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah, it's just a picnic.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This is not a picnic, Phyllis, it's a garden party.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: There's a grill in the warehouse I could bring.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Aw, ew, please don't. Not a barbecue. It's better than a barbecue. It's dignified, quieter, there are rules.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How is that better than a barbecue?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What's the dress code on this?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm glad you asked - Connecticut Casual.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Any chance Connecticut Casual is Pennsylvania Business, i.e. this is what I'm wearing to your party.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Guys, my family just threw a garden party to celebrate my brother's promotion. It was a huge success. Check it out, there's a video online. Heartwarming impromptu father-son duet.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah, Oscar, you showed me this.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I've seen this, that's not you.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Yeah, whoa, who's the sausage?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's my dad and my brother. I would have joined in but this melody doesn't really support another harmony part, so... Check it out, that's my brother's boss. Look how psyched he is, he's having an awesome time.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ah, and did Robert California get an invite to your party?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, of course. Ye... I mean, uh, yeah, I think he did. [groans from the group]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Why didn't you just say this was to impress Robert California?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I cannot believe that Andy is throwing a party like this just to impress the CEO. Classic Gabe move. Hey Andy, how about you don't steal my business strategies, and I won't dress like my life is just one long brunch?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: See you all there at 3 p.m., Connecticut Casual, remember your manners, and have a wonderful time.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And please refer to the map, stay off of the web. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [pointing to computer monitor] So, we've typed in the address, now let's take a look at the street view. [picture of Dwight and Mose on a see-saw]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: They don't warn you when the cameras are driving by.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ah. Why do you keep reading that garden party book? I mean, how hard are finger sandwiches and tea?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: There's so much more to it than that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I've been wanting Schrute Farms to break into the high-end event hosting industry for some time, and this party is a great opportunity. Plus, I've got a secret weapon. [holds up book, Throwing A Garden Party by James Trickington] Only one copy in the world and some sucker on the internet sold it to me for two dollars. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm actually really disappointed in how poorly my book is doing. [holds up same book] I've only sold one copy.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Is there anything you wish you had done differently to avoid cankles?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nope.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I've already gone up another cup size.  The senator is grossed out. When do you start feeling it kick?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Cece was around 22 weeks, but Phillip was much earlier.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Phillip?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, oh my gosh. Yes, but don't, don't say anything, okay? It's after my grandfather.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Phillip is the name that we're using. It's after my favorite cat.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [giggling] Oh, wow. Funny. It's after my grandfather.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It's after my cat.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: [on the phone] Andrew, I've picked up two possible gifts to bring this afternoon. One, a pot of marmalade.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ooh, that sounds great.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Well, that, that is what you want then, the marmalade.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: You don't want to hear the other one. You love marmalade.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Uh, I'll hear the other one.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: It's a basil plant.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You know, the marmalade sounds great.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: I also mentioned the marmalade to my sister and she's very interested.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Then the basil will be fine.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Well, you clearly want the marmalade. Gretchen, I need another marmalade. Alright. [hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey, where do I park?

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.text: I'm the valet. You have to give me your car.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Uh, you know what, I can go park it myself.

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.text: I'm the... I'm the valet. You have to give me your car.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: It's probably okay...

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.text: Give me your car.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I think it's better that I...

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.text: Give me your car.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: It's a finicky car...

quotes.speaker: Mose
quotes.text: Get out. Have a good time at the thing.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: It's a little tricky, you might have to... take... [Mose speeds away]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: MR. RYAN HOWARD!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Chapter 2 - Announcing guests as they enter is the height of decorum. The more volume displayed, the more honor is bestowed upon everyone present.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: STANLEY HUDSON AND HIS MISTRESS CYNTHIA! JAMES, PAMELA, AND PEEPEE HALPERT!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: How's it going over here, guys?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Andy, stop hovering, you're being really annoying.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Didn't mean to bother you, Mabel. Mabel, Mabel, if you're able, keep your elbows off the table.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: MR. AND MRS. WALTER AND ELLEN BERNARD!

quotes.speaker: Walter
quotes.text: So, you all work with Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, technically FOR Andy.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Technically FOR Robert California. He's our CEO.

quotes.speaker: Ellen
quotes.text: I thought you were the CEO.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I don't know how you got there.

quotes.speaker: Walter
quotes.text: You said you were running the company.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This branch, I'm the regional manager.

quotes.speaker: Walter
quotes.text: Yes, that makes more sense. Are you all regional managers?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Did I throw this party to impress my parents? That's crazy. Now, if they wanted a garden party, they could throw one themselves, which, as a matter of fact, they did, last week. They threw one for my baby brother who is totally amazing, but I couldn't care less.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Can I introduce you around now?

quotes.speaker: Walter
quotes.text: Uh, yeah, we don't have too long, we have theater tickets.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What are you going to see?

quotes.speaker: Walter
quotes.text: Money Ball. Walter Jr.'s choice.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What??

quotes.speaker: Walter Jr.
quotes.text: Hey Bronard!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I didn't know you were going to be here.

quotes.speaker: Walter Jr.
quotes.text: I wouldn't have missed it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Ahh! [bird steals her hat]

quotes.speaker: Walter Jr.
quotes.text: I'm Walter, Andy's younger brother.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, hey, how are you doing, I'm Jim.

quotes.speaker: Walter Jr.
quotes.text: Tuna, right? And this must be your lovely wife Pam [looking at Meredith].

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hell no. She wishes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, no, no, no, no. No.

quotes.speaker: Waiter
quotes.text: Sir, I need to be able to feed all the guests.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [mouthful of food] I understand.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Set that down. [grabs waitress] Present yourself.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Chapter 4 - One of the host's most important duties is as Dance Master. A proper courtly dance sets the tone for the entire afternoon.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: LADIES AND GENTLEMEN, MAY I PRESENT, ROBERT CALIFORNIA!

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Hello Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Welcome.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, I want you to meet my first bosses, Mom and Dad.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Yes, hello, nice to meet you.

quotes.speaker: Walter
quotes.text: Pleasure.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Andy, where shall I put your basil plant?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, I thought you were going to bring marmalade.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: No, I'm certain you said basil.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: This is not funny, man, let me down.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I think this thing is broken.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: It's not broken, Kevin. This is how it works.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So pretty today.

quotes.speaker: Ellen
quotes.text: It's getting chilly.

quotes.speaker: Walter
quotes.text: We really should be leaving.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, um, it would be weird if the boss man didn't make a toast, so, hang on. Everybody, I just want to take this opportunity to thank you all for coming, and to raise a glass to my amazing staff.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Toasts are great. I mean, you toast somebody, they toast you back. It just goes round and round. That's my favorite part about toasts, the reciprocity.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Let's hear from you guys, who do you want to toast?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah, I'll say something. I think we should be acknowledging our boss, because none of us would be here without him. Robert California! [everyone toasts]

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I can't believe I didn't think of toasting Robert. Get in the game, Gabriel! Why are you talking to Stanley's mistress?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I would like to toast someone who isn't here but who will be in just four short months. Welcome to the world, Phillip Lipton!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I also would like to toast Phillip Halpert, who is due even sooner. May he be a good namesake to my grandfather who I promised as a child long before tonight that I would one day name my son after him. To Phillip Halpert!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: She just always has to copy anything I do! It's the Ford Taurus situation all over again!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'd like to make a toast to the troops.  All the troops.  Both sides.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I think we should toast...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ladies and gentlemen! The last supper.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Chapter 9 - The tableau vivant is not only welcomed, but expected entertainment at any garden party.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Andy? I think we should acknowledge the man who has led us to such a profitable quarter. To Robert California.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I would also like to toast Robert California. Mr. California,...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You can't triple toast somebody! At least not until we get everyone once.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: I'll say a few words if that's alright with you, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: You people say I led you, but it wasn't me. You want to toast the man who led you to success, but the boss is irrelevant. Andy and I, we produce nothing. We do nothing. We sit in our offices and demand, I want this and that right now, like petulant children. You know, the difference between a crying baby and a manager, one day the baby will grow up. But, without you, Andy and I would be sitting in our dirty diapers, waiting for someone to change us, wipe us.  I should be toasting you, thanking you, for allowing me to have the easiest job in the universe. Cheers.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: To Robert California, from the moment you entered our building and our hearts, you...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Some of you know that we have an internet star in our midst. Mr. Walter Baynes Bernard Sr., please report to the stage!

quotes.speaker: Walter
quotes.text: I'm eating, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ah, come on!

quotes.speaker: Walter
quotes.text: Okay. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Walter
quotes.text: What do you want to do?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, how about one of our classic father/son duets? [starts playing guitar]

quotes.speaker: Walter
quotes.text: Oh, whoa, sure? Really? It's a little tricky.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [singing] Saying I love you is not the words...

quotes.speaker: Walter
quotes.text: It's too high.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Walter
quotes.text: It's high but it's not that high.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Right, it feels strange.

quotes.speaker: Walter
quotes.text: Just take it down a little.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Saying I love... Saying I love you...

quotes.speaker: Walter
quotes.text: Here, give it to me. Okay. Uh, something like... [singing] Saying I love you is...

quotes.speaker: {Andy} & {Walter}
quotes.text: ...not the words...

quotes.speaker: Walter
quotes.text: You don't come in yet. [singing] ...I want to hear from you, It's not that I want you...

quotes.speaker: {Andy} & {Walter}
quotes.text: ...not to say it but if you only knew... More than words is all you have to do to make it real...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Is anyone filming this? Seriously! Erin!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [holding up cell phone] It's either taping or calling.

quotes.speaker: {Andy} & {Walter}
quotes.text: What would you do if my heart was torn in two...

quotes.speaker: Walter
quotes.text: You know what, Walter Jr. is here. Why don't you come up and join us?

quotes.speaker: Walter Jr.
quotes.text: Dad, no. I'm just having a good time getting to know Andy's friends here.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Get up there and sing or I will cut your larynx and you'll never be able to sing again. Woo!

quotes.speaker: {Walter} & {Walter Jr}
quotes.text: [singing] May the good lord be with you down every road you roam. And may sunshine and happiness surround you when you're far from home. And may you grow to be proud, dignified and true. And do unto others as you'd have done to you...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [applauds] Cheers! Alright! Cheers, cheers, cheers, get your own guitar.

quotes.speaker: {Erin}'s Cell Phone
quotes.text: If you'd like to make a call, please hang up and try again.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I am so cold.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: That's because you didn't bring a jacket.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: My first love is beet farming, but it's a young man's game. Who ever heard of an old beet farmer?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Forget the beets. Concentrate on the hosting. I could spend a considerable amount of money having my birthday party here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh really? Well, we have a number of birthday packages. The Pewter Package has the least amount of goats, not no goats, it's still 10-12 goats, depending on the availability of the goats. Now the Goat Package obviously has the most goats. What were you thinking?

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Of course I am not interested in goats. Why would you spend so much time going over the goats with me?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can get you exotic meats - hippo steaks, giraffe burgers...

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: We'll talk. [walks away]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It'll all be goat.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hello, Cece Halpert? This is Andrew Bernard. I'd very much like to speak with you about your paper supply needs. That wasn't even my worst sales call.

quotes.speaker: Walter
quotes.text: [knocks] Hi. What was that display?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I don't know, I just thought if I could throw this great garden party and show you how respected I am that you'd be proud of me.

quotes.speaker: Walter
quotes.text: Andrew...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I know, I know that you're proud of me.

quotes.speaker: Walter
quotes.text: I'm not going to tell you how impressed I am that you're a manager of some rinky dink branch of a paper company in Scranton, Pennsylvania. How long are you going to go on needing my approval? You're a grown man, don't act like a little boy who needs...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I think if I had parents like that I'd be trying to convince everyone all the time how great I was, too.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Guess we found Andy's rosebud.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Rosebud?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It's a reference to Citizen Kane. Something that explains why a person became the way they are.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I know Citizen Kane. Rosebud didn't explain why he was how he was, it just represented what was important to him as a child, that he missed.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Different school of thought. Let's just agree to disagree.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: No. You're wrong.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Are you sure?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yeah! I'm too hot anyway.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: My body has somehow become acclimated to southern Italy. Isn't that strange? I've never been there! Oh, ah, yes, that's nice. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Walter
quotes.text: It was a nice party, the setting was a little strange. Uh, the food...

quotes.speaker: Ellen
quotes.text: Sandwiches were dry.

quotes.speaker: Walter Jr.
quotes.text: Bye Tuna, bye Pam!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey everybody, I'm gonna leave and I just wanted to say I'm really sorry.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Cheeseburger or hamburger.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Um, cheeseburger.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Narddog. [throws Andy a can]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thanks, Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What are they doing?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Closing ceremonies.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nice touch.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think I left my wallet in your house.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Who cares.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: MR. JAMES HALPERT!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Keys, keys...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Stop forgetting things.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I didn't forget them, they're right here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: MR. JAMES HALPERT!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm so sorry, I think I forgot that thing...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What? Idiot.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Whoo.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: MIS... MI... What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, I have a question. Who do you think is really the best salesman in this office?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's a stupid question, obviously mISTER JAMES HALPERT!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I cannot believe how condescending Andy's being.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: He gets condescending when he's nervous. Or when he's excited or sleepy. Not an easy person to be friends with.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Well I just hate being treated like some bum with no class. I'm a lady. I'm a mother. I'm a former boxer!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey guys, getting psyched for the party? Ryan? Can I count on you to wear an understated satirical outfit?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Can't wait. A folk colonialist gathering when unemployment's at 9%. I wouldn't miss it for the world.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Awesome.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Erin....the receptionist!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, oh, oh, Kevin. I am reminded of a lame but useful saying I learned as a kid. What is the difference between Hors d'oeuvres and the animals on Noah's ark?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: With Hors d'oeuvres we only take one at a time.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, OK. What's the difference between a vacuum cleaner and a blonde?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Chapter seven: The host should always present something spectacular to draw the eye of his guests.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: When all this is over, I'd like to actually go to one of Trickington's parties, they sound like a blast.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ladies and Gentlemen! I present to you...the Alamo! [reveals lump of ice]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Little Cici asleep?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, she just went down.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Such a precious little angel.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Aww.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Cecilia....and Phillip.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes, after my grandfather.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Phillip is wasted on you. Jim is never gonna take the time to call him Phillip! He doesn't even take the time to get a haircut. And Phil! Ugh! It's just something you do to a hole!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well I'm having my baby first, so that's that.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You know what? It could go either way. My doctor said my hips are so dainty that I'll most definitely have a C-section, so I could go early.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You think your doctor's going to give you a C-section at six months?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yeah! If I request it he will. And that is that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: My parents are used to a certain type of class. The people that I work with are a different type of class. One is not better than the other, it's just that maybe one's a little higher than the other?
